intro: Zauschneria crassifolia, commonly known as the broadleaf goldbloom, is a flowering plant native to coastal regions of California and Baja California. It is a member of the Plumeria family and is characterized by its showy, orange-red flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. The plant has thick, fleshy leaves that are adapted to conserve water in its arid habitat. It typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils along the coastline. Zauschneria crassifolia is often found in open, sunny areas and is considered a symbol of coastal California's unique flora.
